attributes.Comments: PCBs - outer portion of channel has more sand and lower levels of PCBs; the inner channel has high PCB contaminanation and has not been remediated.

attributes.Dredging_P: 1) Entrance Channel from deep water in Lake Erie to a point just inside outer ends of breakwaters, 2) Outer harbor about 185 acres in area, 3) Ashtabula River channel 100'-160' wide and approx. 10000' upstream.
attributes.Comments: Sediment from the mouth of the river and sections of the outer harbor are contaminated and unsuitable for benificial reuse applications. Material dredged during routine maintenace dredging of the outer harbor is suitable for beneficial reuse.

attributes.Dredging_P: 1) Outer harbor about 4.5 miles long and 1600' wide, 2) S. entrance channel 500'-1000' wide from deep water to point just lakeward of the South Pierhead light,  3) N. entrance channel 800' wide from deep water to outer harbor, 4) Buffalo River channel
attributes.Comments: The material is contaminated and not suitable for beneficial reuse applications.

attributes.Dredging_P: 1) Outer harbor area, 5 miles long and 1600'-2400' wide, 2) Lake approach channel, 3) Entrance channel, 4)Old River channel, 5) Cuyahoga river channel
attributes.Comments: The material is contaminated and not suitable for beneficial reuse applications.

attributes.Dredging_P: 1) An outer harbor about 142 acres in area, 2) An access channel 8' deep, 200' - 150' wide from the outer harbor to the city dock, 3) Inner harbor channel for a distance 2450' upstream of the outer end of the west pier.

1) Outer entrance channel with depth of 17' with a least width of 190' just inside the harbor structures, flaring to a width of 320' about 600' lakeward therof, and extending to deep water. 2) Inner entrance channel and basin to a depth of 16'

1) Entrance Channel, 29' deep, 500'-300' wide, extending from inner end of north pier to deep water, 2) Harbor Basin, 28' deep, generally 1500' wide, extending from entrance channel, 3) Approach Area, 27' deep, 4) Additional harbor areas, 18' & 21' deep

1) Outer harbor, about 360 acres, 25' deep, 2) Grand River channel, 24' deep, 150'-200' wide, extending from outer harbor 3700' upstream; thence 21'  deep, 100'-200' wide an additional 4000' upstream, 3) Turning Basin, 4) 8' deep channel at upstream end
attributes.SdmntCharC: 86%-97% silts & clays at 9 sample sites, w/remainder sands. 93% & 98% sand at other 2 sample sites.

attributes.Dredging_P: 1 )Lake approach channel, 29' deep, 300'-400' wide, 7000' long, 2) Entrance channel, 28' deep, 150'-300' wide, 1900' long, 3) River channel, 27' deep, 120'-350' wide, 1500' long, 4) Turning Basin at upstream limit, 21' deep
attributes.SdmntCharC: 88%-99% silts & clays at 9 of 10 sample sites, w/remainder sands. 38% sand at other 1 sample site.

attributes.Dredging_P: 1) Outer harbor, 60 acres, 25'-28' deep, 2) Lake approach channel, 29' deep, from deep water to outer harbor, 3) Approach channel, 16' deep, from outer harbor to municipal pier, 4) Black River channel, 27' deep, 24' deep at upstream end, 5) Turning Basin
attributes.SdmntCharC: 84%-99.7% silts and clays at 7 of 9 sample sites, with the remainder sands.
attributes.Comments: No final COCs were identified in the River Channel sediments.  However, significant acute toxicity was indicated in sediments in Management Unit LRB-3.
attributes.Comments2: Further treatment and testing of this sediment sample indicated that the acute toxicity associated with Management Unit (MU) was not attributable to ammonia.The toxicity associated with MU LRB-3 sediments may be related to a non-contaminant factor(s)

attributes.Dredging_P: 1) Outer Harbor, about 280 acres, 21'-25' deep,  2) Lake approach channel, 27' deep, from deep water to outer harbor, 3) Oswego River channel, 21'-24' deep, from outer harbor to approx. 2500' upstream

1) Channel of varying width, not exceeding 225', and 14' deep from that depth in lake to a point 150' west of Fox Wharf, thence 100' wide and 8' deep along harbor frontage to vicinity of Miller's Wharf, a distance of 1600'.

attributes.SdmntCharC: 34%-91% sand at 5 of 9 sites w/remainder silts&clays. 74%-86% silts&clays at other 4 sites,

attributes.SdmntCharC: 79.4% to 99.3% silts and clays, with the remainder sand

1) Entrance channel, 15.5' deep and 150' wide from the lake to the bay; Controlling Depth is 12' in the project channel.

attributes.SdmntCharC: 72.9% to 98.8% silts and clays, with the remainder sands
attributes.Comments: COCs where identified in River Channel sediments at Site RM-2
attributes.METALS_Com: The nickel concentration at Site RM-2 was significantly higher than those at the open-lake reference area and open-lake placement area. The concentration also exceeds the Huron/Lake Erie lake plain sediment reference value and may be acutely toxic.
attributes.PAHs_Comme: The total PAH concentration at Site RM-2 was higher than those at the open-lake reference area and open-lake placement area. The total PAH concentration at Site RM-2 may be acutely toxic.
attributes.Comments2: The cyanide concentration at Site RM-2 was significantly higher than those at the open lake reference and placement areas. It is unclear as to whether such a level in sediment is potentially toxic; therefore cyanide was treated as a COC at this site.

attributes.Time_Drgd_: March April May June July August September October November December (Varies by year)
attributes.Comments: Ammonia

Contaminants:Arsenic, Barium, Cadmium, Chromium, Copper, Lead, Mercury, Manganese, Nickel, Zinc, Total Solids, Total Volatile Solids, Cyanide, Chemical Oxygen Demand, Ammonia Nitrogen, Oil & Grease, Total Phosphorus, Total PCB's, Total Organic Carbon
attributes.Comments2: See list above for contaminants of concern that are regularly tested for in dredging sediments at this harbor.  All of the COC's have been detected in the sediment to varying levels.

attributes.Dredging_P: Dredging in Indiana Harbor has not occurred for 35+ years.  Dredging will begin when the CDF is finished
attributes.Comments: Indian Harbor sediment is some of the most highly contaminated sediment on the Great Lakes.

attributes.Dredging_P: Only due to special considerations was the dredging project permitted for Open Lake Disposal for 3 years.  That permit will end in 2009.  After that the Port will most likely have to consider using a CDF for disposal.
attributes.Comments: Mostly ammonia at this time.  The concern is not great enough to prevent Open Lake due to the consideration of a mixing zone.

attributes.Dredging_P: Harbor Project ends at the entrance to the Marina.  Anything past the Marina entrance is considered contaminated.

attributes.Comments: Aresenic, Cadmium and Benzo(a)pyrene are 3 contaminants that have been found in levels that may make this unsuitable for beneficial use in residential areas.  Aresenic level makes industrial questionable.
attributes.Comments2: Sampling results can be made available.

attributes.Dredging_P: Inner Harbor material requires CDF.  Outer Harbor is qualified for clean fill.  ~65K cu.yds. Available.  Need site and project funding.
attributes.Comments: Inner Harbor has PCB's that are of concern.  Outer harbor has been authorized for use as clean fill.
attributes.PCBsDIOXIN: Inner Harbor has PCB's of concern.  Outer Harbor PCB's are below 1ppm.
